bow: babies are expensive we just had new baby girl month ago and the bills are pouring in ca believe how much they charge for stuff baby hearing test 800 that took hour baby stay days in hospital 600 **the total birth is at 67 000 ** luckily we have insurance but we still have to pay out 000 how do people do this without insurance it horrifying isn it something like having baby or receiving treatment for serious disease should not lead to bankruptcy if you don have insurance and if you are already paying for insurance there is literally no reason why the cost should be so high if other countries can provide these services for free why can we want better congratulations on your new baby soak up that new baby smell for me welcome to america 000 for birth that insane have no idea how people in the states could do it stayed week after my section non medically needed and only paid less then 400 because wanted private suite my husband and both have good jobs and paying 6000 just for the birth would be stretch guess that what our emergency savings are for but woof keep in mind you can dispute charges and even file complaint against your insurance provider via your state insurance commissioner if you re not getting fair deal desperate for medicare for all to come true not political argument mean for budgeting and just knowing big bill won break us on top of premiums apply for medicaid in your state as secondary the only go months retroactive if you re eligible but it worth shot removed had what thought was shitty insurance but after hitting my deductible earlier this year only paying about 1500 for week long hospital stay including the birth that doesn count baby nicu time though we haven been billed for that yet ve seen way too many stories on baby related subreddits about people having insurance and still paying several thousand which makes me feel almost lucky to have this stupid insurance plan my pregnancy is expensive due to gd so our out of pocket will be met before his birth next month still though for two ibuprofen 2k for hours in the nursery for our daughter and whatever else they nickel and dime you out of congrats on baby girl yes so much my hospital stay was week+ due to section and the fear of posteclampsia think spelled that right my son was in the nicu for almost that whole time and his bill ended up being 000 just for that the overall bill was almost 70 000 thank god we have insurance but we ll end up paying at least 000 if not more even with double coverage medicaid and blue cross looked at some of the charges 100 fee for us being delayed by 30 minutes for checkout because the nurses and doctors were on the same page not only that but 275 charge for making sure he was breathing after they pulled him out of my body resuscitation charge of almost 300 turns out the price of life could be 70 000 for two people or 000 for one who knew got pregnant while still being covered under my dad health insurance which did cover anything pregnancy related after months of calling applying waiting to hear back continuing to fill out forms and paperwork my medical finally kicked in on september am past my due date by days so ve paid for everything thus far out of pocket even going with midwife more affordable has cost my so amp about 5k lab fees not counting all the costs of baby supplies maternity clothes etc guess the good news is if end up being hospitalized for the birth it will be covered but nothing else about this pregnancy has been the dollar signs are definite turn off to me ever wanting to do this again oh and the only reason got insurance is bc pregnant our household income even though my so and are married pushes me out of the bracket for any free health coverage so once give birth well that whole nother beast to tackle get midwife went once month until the last month or so both my children were born out of hospital and we went home the same day the total cost for my first was 700 out of pocket the second due to our insurance was 1400 there were no tubes wires or any machines except the doppler to hear the baby heartbeat could eat walk scream cry pretty much do and move however wanted to promise it is worth it and yes there was hospital right across the street but would never want my child born in hospital not to mention that she can do the heel stick the same day before you go home and never got the hearing test done on my second one most of the tests they require are not truly required at all it just way to make more money and yes both my kids are vaccinated yep plus paid out of pocket for my epidural each time that was couple grand well spent lol you can also often negotiate lower bill or an interest free payment plan we re paying 250 per month in medical bills and we ll be doing it for long time but who cares since there no interest posted about buy nothing groups recently it really helped us save money on baby stuff https www reddit com babybumps comments cx9wd5 buy nothing groups are amazing for baby stuff utm source=share amp utm medium=ios app amp utm name=iossmf live in australia had both of my children through the public hospital system it costs more through the private hospital system all paid for was the 12 week ultrasound and car parking at the hospital so few hundred dollars per child and that was with almost weekly visits towards the end of each pregnancy an eight day stay in hospital with my first and day stay with my second my deductible to have my daughter was 6500 it was sad and ridiculous guess always get little bitter when hear people get to have babies for free gt but 275 charge for making sure he was breathing after they pulled him out of my body resuscitation charge of almost 300 that ridiculous that large copay my copay through bcbs of ca was total of 500 in the uk now where there universal healthcare removed curious where you live had my daughter in july and our total cost was about 16k before insurance had an emergency section and little extra medical intervention afterward because my bp dropped we were in the hospital from sunday night to thursday afternoon just shocked in the difference in total prices this baffles me just had my 2nd child both sections emergency and elective and had private suites for both and the only thing had to pay for was snacks that wanted from the vending machine seriously didn even have to pay for parking or tv not that used it because the hospital had free wifi and this is in ontario canada those costs of 70k for birth would make me not want to start family because that almost guaranteeing you ll be in some type of debt off the start god so envious our health system isn perfect but the stories hear from the us just break my heart people shouldn have to bankrupt themselves to get vital medical treatment reeeeally not trying to get *too* political but find it really frustrating in the us that there so many anti abortion groups who are also staunchly against things like medicare for all and other social assistance programs for low income mothers and families lucky in my position to be able to afford to have baby it also helps that waited til 34 but because of that limited in how many can have we live in canada but in all seriousness vote democrat this coming election yikes at my hospital the total cost of vaginal delivery and prenatal appointments not including epidural hospital stay medications just the birth amp prenatal appts alone is just under 6000 with insurance it going to cost around 1200 the first half is due by 20 weeks and the rest is due before 40 weeks after my last baby owed the hospital 2700 have no idea what it would cost without insurance we have payment plan that lets us pay interest free if we pay it off in
